      • disguiseAsPlayer

        void disguiseAsPlayer(@NotNull
                      org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                      @NotNull
                      java.lang.String skinName,
                      boolean selfVisible)

        Disguise a player to another Player.

        This effectively changes the player's skin.

        Parameters:
        player - Player who are going to disguise.
        skinName - Account name of the new skin's owner.
        selfVisible - If true, disguise is visible in self perspective.
        Throws:
        DependencyNotFound - is thrown if LibsDisguises is not installed.
        See Also:
        player

      • disguiseAsMob

        void disguiseAsMob(@NotNull
                   org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                   @NotNull
                   org.bukkit.entity.EntityType type,
                   boolean isAdult,
                   boolean selfVisible)

        Disguise a player to a Mob.

        Parameters:
        player - Player who are going to disguise.
        type - Type of this Mob.
        isAdult - Whether this Mob is an adult or a baby.
        selfVisible - If true, disguise is visible in self perspective.
        Throws:
        DependencyNotFound - is thrown if LibsDisguises is not installed.
        See Also:
        player

      • disguiseAsCustomPreset

        void disguiseAsCustomPreset(@NotNull
                            org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                            @NotNull
                            java.lang.String name,
                            boolean selfVisible)

        Disguise a player to a custom saved preset.

        Custom disguise can be saved via /savedisguise name (disguise_data)

        Parameters:
        player - Player who are going to disguise.
        name - Name of the custom preset.
        selfVisible - If true, disguise is visible in self perspective.
        Throws:
        DependencyNotFound - is thrown if LibsDisguises is not installed.
        See Also:
        player, name

      • setSpawnpoint

        @Deprecated
void setSpawnpoint(@NotNull
                                PlayerType type,
                                @NotNull
                                java.lang.String spawnTag)
        Deprecated. 

        Set spawnpoint for the players associated in certain enum PlayerType.

        For team-based spawnpoint, see TeamModule.setSpawnpoint.

        Parameters:
        type - enum PlayerType indicating whose spawnpoint it is.
        spawnTag - Name of the coordinate tag which captures spawnpoints.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if spawnTag is not in this game.
        See Also:
        enum PlayerType, TeamModule.setSpawnpoint

      • setSpawnpoint

        void setSpawnpoint(@NotNull
                   PlayerType type,
                   @NotNull
                   CoordTag tag)

        Set spawnpoint for the players associated in certain enum PlayerType.

        For team-based spawnpoint, see TeamModule.setSpawnpoint.

        Parameters:
        type - enum PlayerType indicating whose spawnpoint it is.
        tag - Coordinate tag which designates spawnpoint(s).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - is raised if tag mode is neither TagMode.SPAWN nor TagMode.AREA.
        See Also:
        enum PlayerType, TeamModule.setSpawnpoint

      • overrideSpawnpoint

        @Deprecated
void overrideSpawnpoint(@NotNull
                                     org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                     @NotNull
                                     java.lang.String tagName,
                                     int index)
        Deprecated. 

        Set new spawnpoint for individual player.

        Default spawnpoint becomes ineffective for that player.

        Parameters:
        player - The target player.
        tagName - Name of the coordinate tag indicating spawnpoint.
        index - (Optional) The capture index of that coordinate tag.This is randomly chosen if you to pass null.
        See Also:
        player

      • overrideSpawnpoint

        void overrideSpawnpoint(@NotNull
                        org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                        @NotNull
                        CoordTag tag,
                        int index)

        Set new spawnpoint for individual player.

        Default spawnpoint becomes ineffective for that player.

        Parameters:
        player - The target player.
        tag - Coordinate tag indicating spawnpoint.
        index - (Optional) The capture index of that coordinate tag.This is randomly chosen if you to pass null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - is raised if tag mode is neither TagMode.SPAWN nor TagMode.AREA.
        See Also:
        player

      • overrideSpawnpoint

        void overrideSpawnpoint(@NotNull
                        org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                        @NotNull
                        org.bukkit.Location location)

        Set new spawnpoint for individual player.

        Default spawnpoint becomes ineffective for that player.

        Parameters:
        player - The target player.
        location - Location of new spawnpoint.
        See Also:
        player

      • resetSpawnpoint

        void resetSpawnpoint(@NotNull
                     org.bukkit.entity.Player player)

        Reset individual spawnpoint back to default one.

        In other words, it discards the spawnpoint previously set for the player via overrideSpawnpoint.

        Parameters:
        player - The target player.
        See Also:
        overrideSpawnpoint
